item.title: Stephen add a quote by Paul Fussell
item.description: "Another reason is that the letters are almost always funny, offering readers the spectacle of some pompous self-celebrator given ample ironic room in which to parade his self-solicited hurt." -- Paul Fussell

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Brian W. Aldiss
item.description: "Whatever terrific events may inform our lives, it always comes to that in the end; we just want to lie down." -- Brian W. Aldiss

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Murray Leinster
item.description: "We do not like the idea that any other creature can be better than we are. It is highly probable that if we ever have to face a superior race, we will die of it." -- Murray Leinster

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Denis Diderot
item.description: "A nation which thinks that it is belief in God and not good law which makes people honest does not seem to me very advanced." -- Denis Diderot

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Edmund Crispin
item.description: "As the popularity of science-fiction increases, so inevitably does the volume of clownish imprecation against it." -- Edmund Crispin

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Ian Cameron Esslemont
item.description: "It takes an unusually philosophic mind to accept that all oneâ€™s suffering might be to no end, really, in the larger scheme of things." -- Ian Cameron Esslemont
